alert.note: Alert for Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Pecos County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles northeast of Fort Stockton to 35 miles southeast of Saragosa. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Stockton, Iraan, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Sierra Madera, Firestone Test Track, Iraan Municipal Airport and Bakersfield. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 244 and 312. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
